Sure, here's an icebreaker activity for the topic "Definition of HR systems and their role in business operations":

Name Game

1. Ask each learner to introduce themselves by saying their name and their current job title or role.
2. As the facilitator, repeat each learner's name and job title, then add a brief description of an HR system that might be relevant to their role. For example, "Hi John, welcome to the session. You mentioned you're a Business Administrator. In your role, you might be using an HR system for managing employee information such as their personal details and employment history."
3. Ask each learner to introduce the next person, by repeating their name and the HR system you described for them in step 2.
4. Continue until everyone has been introduced and their role and an HR system relevant to their role have been shared.

This activity is a great way to get to know each other and introduce the topic of HR systems in a fun and engaging way. It also allows learners to think about how HR systems are relevant to their own roles in the workplace.
